en_second_half: the decibel of a launching rocket, so it’s not like there have been loads of opportunities to bond.
en_results_raw: loud volumes that drown out the world around him. He's a quiet kid, but when he's lost in his music, he might as well be on another planet. So, when he didn't respond to my text asking him to grab milk on his way home, I didn't think much of it. He's done this before, absorbed in his tunes and oblivious to his surroundings. However, this time was different. After an hour of no reply, I started to worry. I tried calling, but his phone went straight to voicemail. This was unlike him. Landon is usually so connected, always with his phone in hand, even if it's just tucked away in his pocket. I tried to rationalize, thinking maybe his phone died or he was just engrossed in a new album release. But as the minutes ticked by, my concern grew. I decided to check his social media, hoping to find a clue. To my surprise, there were no recent posts, no check-ins, nothing. It was as if he had vanished into thin air. My heart raced as I scrolled through his feed, looking for anything that might explain his sudden disappearance. The silence was deafening, and my mind raced with worst-case scenarios. I knew I had to act. I called his best friend, hoping he might have seen Landon or at least heard from him. As I waited for his call to connect, I tried to calm my nerves, reminding myself that Landon is strong and resourceful. He's been through a lot, but he's always bounced back. Yet, the uncertainty gnawed at me. When his friend finally picked up, his voice was filled with confusion. "Landon? Dude, where are you? We've been trying to reach you all day." His words were a mix of relief and concern. "I don't know," he admitted, "I haven't seen him since yesterday afternoon." This was the information I needed. Now, it was time to take action. I quickly gathered my phone, keys, and a flashlight, heading out the door with a sense of urgency. Landon might be many things, but he's never been one to disappear without a word. Something was wrong, and I was determined to find him.
